breakfast.name: Vegan Shakshuka with Whole Wheat Pita
breakfast.preparation: Sauté onion and bell pepper in olive oil until softened. Add garlic and spices and cook for 1 minute. Stir in crushed tomatoes and vegetable broth. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes, then gently stir in the chickpeas. Garnish with parsley and serve with whole wheat pita.
breakfast.nutritionalBenefits: High in fiber, protein, and vitamins A and C. Provides sustained energy and aids digestion.
breakfast.healthNotes: Chickpeas add protein and fiber, promoting satiety and healthy gut bacteria. Spices aid digestion.

lunch.name: Mujadara with Tahini Dressing
lunch.preparation: Caramelize onions in olive oil. Add lentils, vegetable broth, and rice to the pot. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until lentils and rice are cooked through. Whisk together tahini, lemon juice, water, garlic, and cumin for the dressing. Drizzle tahini dressing over the mujadara and garnish with parsley.
lunch.nutritionalBenefits: Rich in protein, fiber, and iron. Supports energy levels and aids digestion. Lentils are an excellent source of plant-based protein.
lunch.healthNotes: Brown rice provides complex carbohydrates for sustained energy. Tahini offers healthy fats and calcium.

dinner.name: Vegan Stuffed Bell Peppers with Quinoa and Vegetables
dinner.preparation: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut bell peppers in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Sauté onion and zucchini in olive oil until softened. Stir in quinoa, tomatoes, walnuts, parsley, oregano, salt, and pepper. Fill bell peppers with the quinoa mixture. Bake for 30-40 minutes, or until bell peppers are tender. Top with vegan feta cheese (optional) before serving.
dinner.nutritionalBenefits: Good source of vitamins A and C, fiber, and protein. Quinoa provides all essential amino acids.
dinner.healthNotes: Colorful bell peppers offer antioxidants and fiber. Walnuts contribute healthy fats and plant-based protein.

snacks.name: Dates Stuffed with Almond Butter
snacks.preparation: Simply stuff each date with 1/2 tablespoon of almond butter.
snacks.nutritionalBenefits: Provides quick energy, fiber, and healthy fats.
snacks.healthNotes: Dates are a natural source of sugars and fiber. Almond butter adds healthy fats and protein.

nutritionalFocus.reason: Promotes healthy digestion, regulates blood sugar levels, and keeps you feeling full.
Essential for muscle building, repair, and overall health. Important for satiety and energy levels.
Crucial for energy production and oxygen transport throughout the body. Important for young women.

weeklyHabitTips: Drink at least 8 glasses of water per day to aid digestion.
Incorporate a variety of colorful fruits and vegetables into your diet.
Practice mindful eating by paying attention to your hunger cues and chewing your food thoroughly.
